creator: Chaz@AlgolX.Net
text:
When an index is displayed (such as at http://landale.algolx.net/chaz/) it does 
not display any aliases which are in that folder (such as 
http://landale.algolx.net/chaz/images/).

Unsure - bug or potential new feature?

It's more a "can't fix".

(a) mod_autoindex doesn't know about any aliases, rewrites, userdir or
vhost_alias configurations. It just reads the directory contents.

(b) Aliases are potentially infinite (think of AliasMatch!). You don't want
that. Really :-)
creator: nd@perlig.de
Chaz@AlgolX.Net
text:
What about new directive for use within directory/location that creates virtual 
directories inside indexes?

As in "<directive> <name> <folder>" where directive is the directive, name is 
the name to be displayed, and folder is the path.. creaes a link within the 
index of that directory which looks like a folder named <name> and sends user 
to <folder>.
How possible/useful would that be you suppose?

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
I don't think that something like that will go into mod_autoindex, which is
supposed to show the contents of a directory (which is complex enough). Once we
may redesign the module, and such things might me pluggable extensions.

Besides that - how would you handle inheritance of your directive to subfolders?
How would you solve conflicts with real filenames?

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
Marking wontfix.  You could probably use symlinks (junctions) to get this if you
really need it.
